intro: Dodonaea triangularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hopper tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal and dry regions. The plant has slender, angular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by woody, three-angled fruits. Dodonaea triangularis is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
